llm_text:
Why: The model signal is driven primarily by payment_format_ach (value=1) which strongly increases the score (SHAP=+2.82389). Secondary contributors increasing the flag are amount_paid (7222.58; SHAP=+0.81003) and dayofweek (5; SHAP=+0.46064). These three features together raised the alert. The to_bank feature (to_bank=14290) had a negative contribution (SHAP=-0.32020), partially offsetting the increase.

Conclusion: The transaction was flagged mainly because it was an ACH payment (payment_format_ach=1) of 7,222.58 (amount_paid) occurring on dayofweek=5, which together raised the model score; the receiving bank (to_bank=14290) reduced the score. If the model weights ACH usage and midâ€‘range amounts on day 5 more heavily, similar transactions would likely be flagged absent stronger negative signals like the one from to_bank.
